Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • Display

  • public class Display
extends Object
    Display contains methods for initializing and opening a GUI to run CRYPTICON. MenuActionListener contains the bindings between every button in the GUI and their respective actions.

      • tryAgain

        public static boolean tryAgain()
        Opens a dialog prompting the user to attempt to find a file again. Is called until a valid filename is retrieved.

      • initImageLabel

        public static JLabel initImageLabel(String filename)
        Creates and returns a filled label with a custom filename.

      • initImageLabel

        public static JLabel initImageLabel(BufferedImage image)
        Returns a filled label with a scaled BufferedImage, rather than a file that must be read from a disk.

      • getText

        public static String getText(int mode)
        Gets input from the input text field and converts it to a string. This method can also retrieve the loaded image's text.

      • getText

        public static String getText()
        Returns the encoded text in the image when no parameter is passed.

      • getOutput

        public static String getOutput()
        Returns the text from the output text field.

      • setText

        public static void setText(String string)
        Sets the text of the output text field to the decrypted text if a message was successfully decrypted from the image.

      • loadBI

        public static void loadBI(BufferedImage image,
          int mode)
        Sets BufferedImage references to the passed in BufferedImage. Afterwards, the initialized label containing the scaled image is displayed.

      • loadImage

        public static void loadImage(String filename)
        Runs loadImage again.

      • loadImage

        public static void loadImage(String filename,
             int mode)
        Resets variables that would have changed upon image opening and changing. Takes given String and checks if the extension is present, and which extensions are valid. Then, it initializes and displays the image specified by the given String filename.

      • initImageLabelS2

        public static void initImageLabelS2(String filename,
                    int mode)
        Performs the post-creation steps to accurately display the new image label created by initImageLabel.

      • initImageLabelS2

        public static void initImageLabelS2(String filename)
        When not passed a mode, performs the default initImageLabel initialization and finishes the post-creation phase to display the image label.

      • fnPrompt

        public static String fnPrompt()
        Prompts the user, by opening a JFileChooser, for a valid filename. This filename will be given back to the method it was called in.

      • fnSave

        public static String fnSave()
        Prompts the user for a location to save the loaded BufferedImage.

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the loaded BufferedImage.

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the loaded BufferedImage.

      • unloadImage

        public static void unloadImage()
        Unloads and nullifies the imageLabel containing the loaded BufferedImage.

      • getImage

        public static BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the unencrypted BufferedImage.

      • getImage

        public static BufferedImage getImage(int mode)
        Depending on the passed in mode, returns the unencrypted loaded BufferedImage, or just the encrypted or not BufferedImage.

      • applyCopy

        public static void applyCopy()
        Add the 'Copy to clipboard' button to the side panel.

      • apply

        public static void apply()
        Adds each element to the side panel in order.

      • centerFrame

        public static void centerFrame()
        Centers CRYPTICON on the desktop.

      • setImageToBeSent

        public static void setImageToBeSent(BufferedImage image)
        Set the passed in BufferedImage to the unencrypted BufferedImage reference in the Display class.

      • applyClear

        public static void applyClear()
        Add the 'clear' button to the side panel.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clear and reset the formatting of the output text field. Disable buttons that would have no function when output text field contains no text.

      • clearEffects

        public static void clearEffects()
        Loads the BufferedImage that was not used when effects were applied. All effects applied to a loaded, unsaved image are reset.

      • setEncodedText

        public static void setEncodedText(String message)
        Store text encoded in the image.

      • lengthError

        public static void lengthError(int over)
        If a desired string to be encoded is too long, produce an error and tell the user how many characters need to be removed.

      • blankError

        public static void blankError()
        If no message is found in the image, display an error.

      • eTimeErrorStart

        public static void eTimeErrorStart()
        Let the user know, if the encryption may take a long time, when the process has started.

      • eTimeErrorEnd

        public static void eTimeErrorEnd()
        If the encryption was thought to take a long time, when the process has finished, notify the user.

      • timeError

        public static int timeError()
        If the decryption of a certain image is thought to take a long time, notifies the user of this, and asks them if they want to proceed.

      • init

        public static void init()
        Sets up the frames to hold the images and menus and loads them.
